critique:
The document outlines an order for the Canal Zone regarding radio communication on ocean-going steamers. The primary goal seems to be safety and regulation, aiming to ensure effective communication for vessels carrying a significant number of people. The tone is authoritative and legalistic. The emotions the President likely wants to elicit are a sense of security (reducing fear), compliance (discouraging anger or disgust), and perhaps a mild surprise at the new regulation, but not excessively so. There's no indication of joy or sadness being targeted.

Sadness: 1 (not applicable)
Anger: 2 (discouraging violation, but not inciting rage)
Fear: 3 (reducing potential dangers at sea)
Disgust: 1 (not applicable)
Surprise: 2 (introducing a new regulation)
